answer_html: \(\mathbf{x}=t \begin{bmatrix} -2\\ 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}.\) There are an infinite number of solutions.
answer_latex:
$\mathbf{x}=t
\begin{bmatrix}
-2\\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix}.$ There are an infinite number of solutions.
hints_html: Recall that if the matrix has a row of zeros then the corresponding value in the augmented part of the matrix must be zero or there is no solution.
hints_latex:
Recall that if the matrix has a row of zeros then the corresponding
value in the augmented part of the matrix must be zero or there is no
solution.
hints_raw: Recall that if the matrix has a row of zeros then the corresponding value in the augmented part of the matrix must be zero or there is no solution.
question: B 04 (b)
sols_html:
From the matrix,

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{ccc}1 & 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right.\left| \begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

we see that the third row is all zeros (including the augmented part) and so one of the variables is a free parameter. From the second row we see that x_3=0. Let the free parameter be x_2. Then from the first row we see that x_1=-2x_2. Therefore we have a null vector,

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} -2\\ 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

and the solution is

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{x}=t \begin{bmatrix} -2\\ 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}.\end{aligned}\]

There are an infinite number of solutions.
sols_raw:
From the matrix,

:<math>
\left[\begin{array}{ccc}1 & 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right. \left| \begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right]
</math>

we see that the third row is all zeros (including the augmented part) and so one of the variables is a free parameter.  From the second row we see that x_3=0.  Let the free parameter be x_2.  Then from the first row we see that x_1=-2x_2.  Therefore we have a null vector,

:<math>
\begin{bmatrix}
-2\\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix}
</math>

and the solution is

:<math>
\mathbf{x}=t
\begin{bmatrix}
-2\\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix}.
</math>

There are an infinite number of solutions.
statement_html:
The augmented matrix below for a linear system is put in reduced row echelon form with row operations. Write one of the following:

  • the solution if it is unique

  • all solutions if there are more than one

  • state that there are no solutions.

(b)

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{ccc}1 & 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right.\left| \begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]
statement_raw:
The augmented matrix below for a linear system is put in reduced row echelon form with row operations. Write one of the following:
* the solution if it is unique
* all solutions if there are more than one
* state that there are no solutions.

'''(b)'''
:<math>
\left[\begin{array}{ccc}1 & 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right. \left| \begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right]
</math>
